bitfield.description: Set whenever any 'error' interrupt (MF1-4,IFL1-4,IFH1-4,SDFFOVF1-4) is active
SDFIFO data ready interrupt for Ch4
SDFIFO data ready interrupt for Ch3
SDFIFO data ready interrupt for Ch2
SDFIFO data ready interrupt for Ch1 0: SDFIFO data ready interrupt has NOT occurred 1: SDFIFO data ready interrupt has occurred
FIFO Overflow Flag for Ch4
FIFO Overflow Flag for Ch3
FIFO Overflow Flag for Ch2
FIFO Overflow Flag for Ch1 0 - FIFO has not overflowed 1 - FIFO overflowed. # words received in FIFO ' FIFO depth (16), NEW word is lost
Acknowledge flag for Filter 4 0: No new data available for Filter (in non-FIFO mode) 1: New data available for Filter (in non-FIFO mode)
Acknowledge flag for Filter 3 0: No new data available for Filter (in non-FIFO mode) 1: New data available for Filter (in non-FIFO mode)
Acknowledge flag for Filter 2 0: No new data available for Filter (in non-FIFO mode) 1: New data available for Filter (in non-FIFO mode)
Acknowledge flag for Filter 1 0: No new data available for Filter (in non-FIFO mode) 1: New data available for Filter (in non-FIFO mode)
Modulator Failure for Filter 4 0: Modulator is operating normally for Filter 1: Modulator failure for Filter
Modulator Failure for Filter 3 0: Modulator is operating normally for Filter 1: Modulator failure for Filter
Modulator Failure for Filter 2 0: Modulator is operating normally for Filter 1: Modulator failure for Filter
Modulator Failure for Filter 1 0: Modulator is operating normally for Filter 1: Modulator failure for Filter
CEVT2 Interrupt flag for filter4 0: CEVT2 event has not occured 1: CEVT2 event has occurred
CEVT1 Interrupt flag for filter4 0: CEVT1 event has not occured 1: CEVT1 event has occurred
CEVT2 Interrupt flag for filter3 0: CEVT2 event has not occured 1: CEVT2 event has occurred
CEVT1 Interrupt flag for filter3 0: CEVT1 event has not occured 1: CEVT1 event has occurred
CEVT2 Interrupt flag for filter2 0: CEVT2 event has not occured 1: CEVT2 event has occurred
CEVT1 Interrupt flag for filter2 0: CEVT1 event has not occured 1: CEVT1 event has occurred
CEVT2 Interrupt flag for filter1 0: CEVT2 event has not occured 1: CEVT2 event has occurred
CEVT1 Interrupt flag for filter1 0: CEVT1 event has not occured 1: CEVT1 event has occurred

Flag-clear bit for SDFM Master Interrupt flag. Writing a 1 to clear MIF flag in SDIFLG register Writes of '0' are ignored. Note: If the MIF flag is cleared and other Interrupts are still pending, MIF will again be set to 1 on the following SysClk cycle, and the INT output will be reasserted (pulsed low)
SDFIFO data ready Interrupt flag-clear bit for Ch4
SDFIFO data ready Interrupt flag-clear bit for Ch3
SDFIFO data ready Interrupt flag-clear bit for Ch2
SDFIFO data ready Interrupt flag-clear bit for Ch1
SDFIFO overflow clear Ch4
SDFIFO overflow clear Ch3
SDFIFO overflow clear Ch2
SDFIFO overflow clear Ch1
Flag-clear bit for Acknowledge flag for Filter 4
Flag Clear bit for AF3
Flag Clear bit for AF2
Flag Clear bit for AF1
Flag Clear bit for MF4
Flag Clear bit for MF3
Flag Clear bit for MF2
Flag Clear bit for MF1
Flag Clear bit for FLT4_FLG_CEVT2
Flag Clear bit for FLT4_FLG_CEVT1
Flag Clear bit for FLT3_FLG_CEVT2
Flag Clear bit for FLT3_FLG_CEVT1
Flag Clear bit for FLT2_FLG_CEVT2
Flag Clear bit for FLT2_FLG_CEVT1
Flag Clear bit for FLT1_FLG_CEVT2
Flag Clear bit for FLT1_FLG_CEVT1
Master SDy_ERR interrupt enable 0: SDy_ERR Interrupt and interrupt flags are disabled 1: SDy_ERR Interrupt and interrupt flags are enabled
Flag Clear bit for HZ4
Flag Clear bit for HZ3
Flag Clear bit for HZ2
Flag Clear bit for HZ1
Master Filter Enable 0: All the four data filter units of SDFM module are disabled. All FIFOs are cleared 1: Data filter units can be enabled if bit FEN is '1'.

High-level Threshold crossing (Z) flag Ch4 Primarily intended for detecting 'zero'-crossing events. Unlike the primary comparator IFHx flag, it does not have the ability to generate an interrupt. 0: Comparator filter output ' SDCMPHZ4.HLTZ 1: Comparator filter output '= SDCMPHZ4.HLTZ

High-level Threshold crossing (Z) flag Ch3 Primarily intended for detecting 'zero'-crossing events. Unlike the primary comparator IFHx flag, it does not have the ability to generate an interrupt. 0: Comparator filter output ' SDCMPHZ3.HLTZ 1: Comparator filter output '= SDCMPHZ3.HLTZ

High-level Threshold crossing (Z) flag Ch2 Primarily intended for detecting 'zero'-crossing events. Unlike the primary comparator IFHx flag, it does not have the ability to generate an interrupt. 0: Comparator filter output ' SDCMPHZ2.HLTZ 1: Comparator filter output '= SDCMPHZ2.HLTZ

High-level Threshold crossing (Z) flag Ch1 Primarily intended for detecting 'zero'-crossing events. Unlike the primary comparator IFHx flag, it does not have the ability to generate an interrupt. 0: Comparator filter output ' SDCMPHZ1.HLTZ 1: Comparator filter output '= SDCMPHZ1.HLTZ
0: SD Data is not passed through a synchronizer. 1: SD Data is passed through a synchronizer.
0: SD Clock is not passed through a synchronizer. 1: SD Clock is passed through a synchronizer.
SD1 Clock source select. 0: Clock source to SDFM filter is its channel clock. 1: Clock source to SDFM filter is SD1 filter clock.
Modulator clock modes 0: Mode 0: Modulator clock running at 1x data rate 1: Reserved 2: Reserved 3: Reserved

PWM synchronization (SDSYNC) of data filter 0: PWM synchronization of data filter is disabled 1: PWM synchronization of data filter is enabled Note: SDSYNCx.SYNCSEL bits define which PWM signal is used to synchronize PWMs

Data filter structure 00: Data filter runs with a Sincfast structure 01: Data filter runs with a Sinc1 structure 10: Data filter runs with a Sinc2 structure 11: Data filter runs with a Sinc3 structure
Data filter Acknowledge Enable 0: Acknowledge flag is disabled for the particular filter 1: Acknowledge flag is enabled for the particular filter

Filter Enable 0: The data filter is disabled and no data is produced 1: The data filter is enabled and data are produced in the data filter Note: When filter is disabled, DOSR counter held in reset, filter data erased. Also resets FIFO pointers and clears the FIFO
Data filter Oversampling ratio The actual oversampling ratio of data filter is DOSR + 1 These bits set the oversampling ratio of the data filter. 0x0FF represents an oversampling ratio of 256.
Shift Control These bits indicate by how many bits the 16-bit window is shifted up when 16-bit data representation is chosen.
Data filter Data representation 0: Data stored in 16b 2's complement 1: Data stored in 32b 2's complement
Unsigned high-level threshold for the comparator filter output.
Unsigned low-level threshold for the comparator filter output.
Comparator Event2 Select 00: COMPL1 01: COMPL1 OR COMPH1 10: COMPL2 11: COMPL2 OR COMPH2
Comparator Filter enable 0: Disable comparator filter 1: Enable comparator filter
Comparator Event1 Select 00: COMPH1 01: COMPL1 OR COMPH1 10: COMPH2 11: COMPL2 OR COMPH2
High level (Z) Threshold crossing output enable 0: Disable Higher level Threshold (Z) crossing 1: Enable Higher level Threhold (Z) crossing
Modulator Failure Interrupt Enable 0: Disable modulator failure interrupt and its flag 1: Enable modulator failure interrupt and its flag

Comparator filter structure 00: Comparator filter runs with a sincfast structure 01: Comparator filter runs with a Sinc1 structure 10: Comparator filter runs with a Sinc2 structure 11: Comparator filter runs with a Sinc3 structure
CEVT2 interrupt enable 0: Disable CEVT2 interrupt 1: Enable CEVT2 interrupt
CEVT1 interrupt enable 0: Disable CEVT1 interrupt 1: Enable CEVT1 interrupt
Comparator Oversampling ratio. The actual rate is COSR + 1. These bits set the oversampling ratio of the filter. 0x1F represents an oversampling ratio of 32
Hi-order 16b in 32b mode, 16-bit Data in 16b mode
Lo-order 16b in 32b mode
Hi-order 16b in 32b mode, 16-bit Data in 16b mode
Lo-order 16b in 32b mode
Comparator Data output - 16b only
Second Unsigned high-level threshold for the comparator filter output.

Unsigned High-level threshold (Z) for the comparator filter output Primarily intended for detecting 'zero'-crossing events. Unlike the primary comparator SDCMPHx, it does not have the ability to generate an interrupt.
SDFIFO Overflow interrupt enable 0: SDFIFO Overflow condition will not generate an interrupt 1: SDFIFO overflow condition generates an interrupt on SDy_ERR
Data-Ready Interrupt (DRINT) source select 0 = AF1 (Select non-FIFO data-ready interrupt) 1 = SDFFINT1 (Select FIFO data-ready interrupt)
SDFIFO Enable 0: Disable FIFO operation 1: Enable FIFO operation Note: When FIFO is disabled, FIFO contents are cleared
SDFIFO data ready Interrupt Enable
SDFIFO Status 00000 FIFO empty 00001 FIFO has 1 word . . . . 10000 FIFO has 16 words
SDFIFO interrupt level bits The FIFO will generate an interrupt when the FIFO status (SDFFST) '= FIFO level (SDFFIL )
WTSYNFLG Clear-on-FIFOINT Enable 0: WTSYNFLG can only be cleared manually (using WTSYNCLR bit) 1: WTSYNFLG is cleared automatically on SDFFINT
FIFO Clear-on-SDSYNC Enable 0: SDFIFO is not automaticaly cleared upon receiving SDSYNC 1: SDFIFO is automaticaly cleared upon receiving SDSYNC
Wait-for-Sync Flag Clear (always reads 0) 0: Write of 0 has no affect 1: Write of 1 clears WTSYNFLG
Wait-for-Sync Flag 0: SDSYNC event has not occurred 1: SDSYNC event occurred.
Wait-for-Sync Enable 0: Incoming Data written to SDFIFO on every Data-Ready (DR) Event 1: Incoming Data written to SDFIFO on DR event only after SDSYNC event occurs
Defines source for the SDSYNC Input on this channel Refer SDSYNCx.SYNCSEL table
Second Unsigned low-level threshold for the comparator filter output.
0: SD Data is not passed through a synchronizer. 1: SD Data is passed through a synchronizer.
0: SD Clock is not passed through a synchronizer. 1: SD Clock is passed through a synchronizer.
SD2 Clock source select. 0: Clock source to SDFM filter is its channel clock. 1: Clock source to SDFM filter is SD1 filter clock.

Second Unsigned low-level threshold for the comparator filter output.
High comparator COMPH source select. 0 CEVT2 output drives COMPLOUT 1 Reserved 2 Output of digital filter drives COMPLOUT 3 Reserved
High comparator COMPH source select. 0 CEVT1 output drives COMPHOUT 1 Reserved 2 Output of digital filter drives COMPHOUT 3 Reserved
Low filter initialization. 0 No effect 1 Initialize all samples to the filter input value
Low filter majority voting threshold. At least THRESH samples of the opposite state must appear within the sample window in order for the output to change state.
Low filter sample window size. Number of samples to monitor is SAMPWIN+1.
Low filter sample clock prescale. Number of system clocks between samples.
High filter initialization. 0 No effect 1 Initialize all samples to the filter input value
High filter majority voting threshold. At least THRESH samples of the opposite state must appear within the sample window in order for the output to change state.
High filter sample window size. Number of samples to monitor is SAMPWIN+1.
High filter sample clock prescale. Number of system clocks between samples.

Lock write-access to the SDCOMP1EVT1/2FLTTCTL and COMP1FILCLKCTL registers. 0 SDCOMP1EVT1/2FLTCTL and SDCOMP1EVT1/2FLTCLKCTL registers are not locked. Write 0 to this bit has no effect. 1 SDCOMP1EVT1/2FLTCTL and SDCOMP1EVT1/2FLTCLKCTL registers are locked. Only a system reset can clear this bit.
Lock write-access to the SDCOMP1CTL register. 0 SDCOMP1CTL register is not locked. Write 0 to this bit has no effect. 1 SDCOMP1CTL register is locked. Only a system reset can clear this bit.
High comparator COMPH source select. 0 CEVT2 output drives COMPLOUT 1 Reserved 2 Output of digital filter drives COMPLOUT 3 Reserved
High comparator COMPH source select. 0 CEVT1 output drives COMPHOUT 1 Reserved 2 Output of digital filter drives COMPHOUT 3 Reserved
Low filter initialization. 0 No effect 1 Initialize all samples to the filter input value
Low filter majority voting threshold. At least THRESH samples of the opposite state must appear within the sample window in order for the output to change state.
Low filter sample window size. Number of samples to monitor is SAMPWIN+1.
Low filter sample clock prescale. Number of system clocks between samples.
High filter initialization. 0 No effect 1 Initialize all samples to the filter input value
High filter majority voting threshold. At least THRESH samples of the opposite state must appear within the sample window in order for the output to change state.
High filter sample window size. Number of samples to monitor is SAMPWIN+1.
High filter sample clock prescale. Number of system clocks between samples.

Lock write-access to the SDCOMP2EVT1/2FLTTCTL and COMP2FILCLKCTL registers. 0 SDCOMP2EVT1/2FLTCTL and SDCOMP2EVT1/2FLTCLKCTL registers are not locked. Write 0 to this bit has no effect. 1 SDCOMP2EVT1/2FLTCTL and SDCOMP2EVT1/2FLTCLKCTL registers are locked. Only a system reset can clear this bit.
Lock write-access to the SDCOMP2CTL register. 0 SDCOMP2CTL register is not locked. Write 0 to this bit has no effect. 1 SDCOMP2CTL register is locked. Only a system reset can clear this bit.
